IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE HUN SCHOOL OF PRINCETON IS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING A STRONG COLLEGE PREPATORY PROGRAM LEADING TO INFORMED COLLEGE CHOICES. THE FACULTY AND CURRICULUM ARE RESPONSIVE (SCH. O)
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE HUN SCHOOL OF PRINCETON IS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING A STRONG COLLEGE PREPATORY PROGRAM LEADING TO INFORMED COLLEGE CHOICES. THE FACULTY AND CURRICULUM ARE RESPONSIVE TO INDIVIDUAL LEARNING STYLES AND INTERESTS. THE TOTAL PROGRAM IS COMMITTED TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOLID SCHOLARSHIP AND SOUND CHARACTER IN AN ENVIRONMENT DEDICATED TO TIMELESS VALUES, HONOR, SERVICE, PERSERVERANCE, RESPONSIBLITY, COMPASSION, RESPECT AND LEADERSHIP.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDED COLLEGE PREPARATORY SECONDARY EDUCATION FOR GRADES SIX THROUGH TWELVE FOR 642 STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COST OF GOODS SOLD - $ 289,394 RENTAL EXPENSE - 69,273 FUNDRAISING EXPENSES - 34,908 TOTAL $ 393,575
COST OF GOODS SOLD - $ 289,394 RENTAL EXPENSE - 69,273 FUNDRAISING EXPENSES - 34,908 TOTAL $ 393,575
AS DESIGNATED BY THE DONOR FOR PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED AND AS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD FOR BOARD RESTRICTED.

ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA REQUIRE MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE SCHOOL AND RECOGNIZE A TAX LIABILITY (OR ASSET) IF THE SCHOOL HAS TAKEN AN UNCERTAIN POSITION THAT MORE LIKELY THAN NOT WOULD NOT BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE. MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE SCHOOL, AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2016, THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY (OR ASSET) OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE SCHOOL FILES TAX RETURNS IN THE U.S. FEDERAL JURISDICTION, AS WELL AS THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY AND HAS NO INCOME TAX RELATED PENALTIES AND INTEREST FOR PERIODS PRESENTED IN THESE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. SHOULD ANY SUCH PENALTIES AND INTEREST BE INCURRED, THE SCHOOL'S POLICY WOULD BE TO RECOGNIZE THEM AS OPERATING EXPENSES. IN THE NORMAL COURSE OF BUSINESS, THE SCHOOL IS SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES. AS OF JUNE 30, 2016, AND THROUGH THE DATE OF THIS REPORT THERE ARE NO ON-GOING AUDITS OR UNRESOLVED DISPUTES WITH THE VARIOUS TAX AUTHORITIES THAT THE SCHOOL FILES WITH. AS OF JUNE 30, 2016 AND 2015, THE SCHOOL HAD NO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS.

THE POLICY IS INCLUDED IN BROCHURES, CATALOGUES AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATIONS DEALING WITH STUDENT ADMISSIONS, PROGRAMS AND SCHOLARSHIPS. IN CONJUNCTION WITH NEW JERSEY ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS AND THE ASSOCIATION OF DELAWARE VALLEY INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS, WE PLACE ADS STATING OUR NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IN AREA NEWSPAPERS. WE HAVE PLACED ADS IN THE STAR LEDGER, THE PHILIDELPHIA INQUIRER AND THE PHILADELPHIA DAILY NEWS.
THE SCHOOL PAID A CONTRACTOR LOCATED IN CANADA FOR THE INSTALLATION OF FIELDTURF.
THE SCHOOL ESTABLISHED A COMMITTEE TO REVIEW APPLICATIONS AND AWARD FINANCIAL AID BASED ON NEED.
THE HEADMASTER IS REQUIRED TO LIVE ON SCHOOL GROUNDS.

THE TOTAL ISSUE PRICE IS $23,000,000, OF WHICH $13,660,000 WAS USED TO PAY OFF THE OUTSTANDING BALANCE ON THE 2004 BONDS AND $280,950 WAS USED TO PAY FINANCING COSTS. THE REMAINING BALANCE OF $9,059,050 IS BEING TREATED AS A CONSTRUCTION LOAN AND IS BEING DRAWN DOWN AS NEEDED. AS OF JUNE 30, 2016, $5,796,310 HAD BEEN DRAWN DOWN ON THE LOAN.

DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2016 THE SCHOOL PAID $139,683 TO SCOZZARI BUILDERS INCORPORATED, OF WHICH NICHOLAS SCOZZARI IS A GREATER THAN 35% OWNER. NICHOLAS SCOZZARI STEPPED DOWN AS A BOARD MEMBER DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2016, AFTER THE CONTRACT WAS AWARDED TO HIS COMPANY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION WAS PROVIDED A COPY OF THE FORM 990 FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT PRIOR TO FILING THE RETURN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY, BOARD MEMEBERS REVIEW THE SCHOOL'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HEADMASTER RECEIVES AN ANNUAL REVIEW BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR PERFOMANCE THROUGHOUT THE FISCAL YEAR. THE HEADMASTER HAS A THREE YEAR CONTRACT THAT OUTLINES POTENTIAL SALARY INCREASES AND THE BOARD WILL DETERMINE IF AN INCREASE IS APPROPRIATE BASED ON THEIR REVIEW. OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES RECEIVE ANNUAL REVIEWS BY THE HEADMASTER. THE BOARD APPROVES A BUDGET AND A SET AMOUNT OF OVERALL SALARY INCREASES EACH YEAR. THE HR DIRECTOR WILL DO BENCHMARKING FOR ALL OF THE OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES AND THE HR DIRECTOR AND THE HEADMASTER WILL DISCUSS IF COMPENSATION ADJUSTMENTS ARE NECESSARY. THE HEADMASTER TYPICALLY INFORMS THE BOARD CHAIR AND/OR FINANCE COMMITTEE CHAIR WHEN HE RECOMMENDS COMPENSATION ADJUSTMENTS FOR THE OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES, BUT BOARD APPROVAL IS NOT NEEDED TO MAKE THOSE ADJUSTMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST FROM THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART IV, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ALL OF ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS A FINANCE COMMITTEE THAT REVIEWS THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENT BY THE INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

TO INDIVIDUAL LEARNING STYLES AND INTERESTS. THE TOTAL PROGRAM IS COMMITTED TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOLID SCHOLARSHIP AND SOUND CHARACTER IN AN ENVIRONMENT DEDICATED TO TIMELESS VALUES, HONOR, SERVICE, PERSERVERANCE, RESPONSIBILITY, COMPASSION, RESPECT AND LEADERSHIP.
